title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Description must include two types of spatial data.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly describe at least two of the following kinds of information used by geographers to map food deserts:

· Geographers can map access to a resource (grocery stores, supermarkets, supercenters) and where people live (distance from a store)

· Geographers can map where stores are located versus socioeconomic and demographic information (income, race, and age)

· Geographers can map the location of local residents and access to public transportation or a private vehicle

The response correctly describes at least two of the following kinds of information used by geographers use to map food deserts:

· Geographers can map access to a resource (grocery stores, supermarkets, supercenters) and where people live (distance from a store)

· Geographers can map where stores are located versus socioeconomic and demographic information (income, race, and age)

· Geographers can map the location of local residents and access to public transportation or a private vehicle
